Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Quarterstaff \Quar"ter*staff`\, n.; pl. {Quarterstaves}. A long and stout staff formerly used as a weapon of defense and offense; -- so called because in holding it one hand was placed in the middle, and the other between the middle and the end. [1913 Webster]
quarterstaff n : a long stout staff used as a weapon [also: {quarterstaves} (pl)]
